boards.title: Africa
boards.description: Africa is the second continent in the world in terms of population and the third in area. With an area of ​​about 30,221,532 km² including adjacent islands.

boards.title: Asia
boards.description: Asia is the largest continent and the most demographic of the seven largest continents in the world. It covers 8.7% of the total area of ​​the Earth.

boards.title: North America
boards.description: North America is a continent located in the Northern Hemisphere of the Earth, east of the Pacific Ocean and west of the Atlantic Ocean, south of the Arctic Ocean, north of South America

boards.title: South America
boards.description: South America is the continental part of the western part of the Earth's Southern Hemisphere, starting south of the Panama Canal and below.

boards.title: Europe
boards.description: Geologically and geographically, Europe is a peninsula or subcontinent, forming the westernmost part of Eurasia, or even Eurasia, depending on how it looks.

boards.title: Oceania
boards.description: Oceania is a geographical region that includes Melanesia, Micronesia, Polynesia and Australasia. The continent is spread over the Eastern Hemisphere and Western Hemisphere, covering an area of ​​8,725,989 km² and a population of about 40 million.
